title: Britain's youngest Euromillions winner drops case against Lotto for 'ruining her life' | Metro News
text:
Toby Meyjes for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 15 Feb 2017 3:52 pm Jane Park told Loose Women that she is not following up on plans to sue Lotto bosses (Picture: Ken McKay/ITV/REX/Shutterstock) 
Britain’s youngest Euromillions winner has revealed she has dropped her plans to sue Lotto bosses for ‘ruining her life ‘. 
Jane Park, who won £1 million at 17, had threatened to sue Camelot for negligence arguing that someone as young as she was should not have been allowed to win. Pizza delivery driver leaves note offering 'weed, MDMA, pills, ket, raw coke & much more' 
But the now 21-year-old told ITV’s Loose Women today that she had already achieved her aim of campaigning for the age limit to be raised to 18. 
Jane, who is from Edinburgh, admitted she had spoken to a lawyer but would not be pursuing any legal action. 
Asked if she still planned to sue, she said: ‘No. What I said was me phoning up the lottery and saying,”I think 16 is too young, you should up the age to 18″, they were never going to be like, ‘”Jane that’s great, we’ll up our age”. She had argued that 16 was too young to scoop the jackpot (Picture: Ken McKay/ITV/REX/Shutterstock) 
‘So what I did was, I’d only spoke to a lawyer, I was just wanting to seek legal advice just to get my point across, get it out there. 
‘But because it has gone so far already, I won’t even have to go any further, I feel like I have been listened to now and people are actually listening to the difficulties.’ 
She added: ‘I’m not saying I’m completely unhappy because there is parts of my life that are good and there’s days that I wouldn’t change anything but there is days when I’m upset and it does get on top of me.’ 
Jane said did not want to give her money away as she wanted to have children in the future and provide for them. 
However, in an interview on Sunday, she said sometimes she wishes she ‘had never won at all’ . But the 21-year-old told Loose Women she thinks she has got her point across (Picture: Ken McKay/ITV/REX/Shutterstock) Jane is the youngest Brit to scoop the jackpot (Picture:PA) 
Her frank admission came days after she pleaded not guilty to drink-driving at a McDonald’s. 
She said: ‘People look at me and think, âEuro ~I wish I had her lifestyle, I wish I had her moneyâEuro but they donâEuro t realise the extent of my stress. 
‘They don’t know what they’re wishing for. They would need to spend some time in my shoes to understand. 
‘I have material things but apart from that, my life is empty. What is my purpose in life?’ 
She added: ‘I think 18 should be the minimum age for winning the lottery, at the least. The current age of 16 is far too young. 
‘At times, it feels like winning the lottery has ruined my life. I thought it would make it 10 times better but it’s made it 10 times worse.’ More
